solution_line_template: The used car lot has {total_vehicles} / {motorcycle_fraction_denominator} = <<{total_vehicles}/{motorcycle_fraction_denominator}={motorcycles}>>{motorcycles} motorcycles with {motorcycle_tires} tires each.
The lot has {total_vehicles} - {motorcycles} = <<{total_vehicles}-{motorcycles}={cars}>>{cars} cars for sale
There are {cars} / {spare_tire_fraction_denominator} = {cars_with_spare} cars with a spare tire with {tires_per_car_with_spare} tires each.
The lot has {cars} - {cars_with_spare} = <<{cars}-{cars_with_spare}={cars_without_spare}>>{cars_without_spare} cars with {tires_per_car_without_spare} tires each.

Thus, the used car lot's vehicles have {motorcycles} * {motorcycle_tires} + {cars_with_spare} * {tires_per_car_with_spare} + {cars_without_spare} * {tires_per_car_without_spare} = {motorcycles * motorcycle_tires} + {cars_with_spare * tires_per_car_with_spare} + {cars_without_spare * tires_per_car_without_spare} = <<{motorcycles}*{motorcycle_tires}+{cars_with_spare}*{tires_per_car_with_spare}+{cars_without_spare}*{tires_per_car_without_spare}={total_tires}>>{total_tires} tires in all.
